intro: Chamaelirium actinomorphum, commonly known as the starflower, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to the eastern United States. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its finely divided, fern-like leaves. The plant produces small, white to pinkish flowers arranged in a flat-topped cluster, giving it its common name. It thrives in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and stream banks. Its botanical features make it an attractive addition to native plant gardens and ecological restoration projects.
